question: Question_01_(i)
statement:
Determine whether $\int_{1}^{\infty}\frac{dx}{1 + 2x}$ converges or
diverges. If it converges, evaluate it.
hints:
You can either calculate this directly (Hint 2, Solution 1) or compare
it a known \emph{p}-integral (Hint 3, Solution 2).

If you want to calculate this directly, how do you deal with the upper
bound being infinity? Recall that an improper integral like this is the
limit of proper (normal) integral.

Comparing the exponents of the polynomial on the top (0) and on the
bottom (1) we see that the difference is 1. Hence we suspect that the
integral converges or diverges? (Continue at Hint 4)

We expect the integral to diverge, since $\int_1^\infty \frac1{x}\,dx$
diverges. Hence, you want to show that

\begin{align*}\frac1{1+2x} \geq C \frac1{x}\end{align*}

and then use the integral comparison test.
